ftc.team6460.javadeck.api.peripheral

Interface EffectorPeripheral<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of output that this peripheral can effect. For example, a peripheral such as a simple transistor, that can only switch on and off, would be considered a boolean output, while a motor can be considered a real number.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Maintainable, RobotPeripheral
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    EncoderedMotor, UnencoderedMotor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AntiStallFilter, MotorGearingFilter, ReadbackFilter, SelfContainedServo, ServoFeedbackMotor

    public interface EffectorPeripheral<T>
extends RobotPeripheral
    Describes a peripheral that can output an effect.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addSafetyGroup(SafetyGroup grp)
      Adds this effector to the given safety group.
      void safetyShutdown(long nanos)
      Shut down to a known safe state, immediately.
      void write(T input)
      Writes the value to the effector, and waits for the effector to reach its target value.
      void writeFast(T input)
      Writes the value to the effector, and returns immediately after the write is finished.

      • Methods inherited from interface ftc.team6460.javadeck.api.Maintainable

        loop, setup

    • Method Detail

      • write

        void write(T input)
    throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
           PeripheralCommunicationException,
           PeripheralInoperableException
        Writes the value to the effector, and waits for the effector to reach its target value.
        Parameters:
        input - The value to write.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If interrupted waiting for the effector to reach its target value.
        PeripheralCommunicationException - If the effector cannot be communicated with.
        PeripheralInoperableException - If the effector is inoperable.

      • writeFast

        void writeFast(T input)
        throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
               PeripheralCommunicationException,
               PeripheralInoperableException
        Writes the value to the effector, and returns immediately after the write is finished.
        Parameters:
        input - The value to write.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If interrupted waiting for the write to finish.
        PeripheralCommunicationException - If the effector cannot be communicated with.
        PeripheralInoperableException - If the effector is inoperable.

      • safetyShutdown

        void safetyShutdown(long nanos)
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                    PeripheralCommunicationException,
                    PeripheralInoperableException
        Shut down to a known safe state, immediately.
        Parameters:
        nanos - The number of nanoseconds for the shutdown to stay in effect. If any exception is thrown, the state of the effector is unknown. Depending on its role, the program may take other actions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        PeripheralCommunicationException
        PeripheralInoperableException

      • addSafetyGroup

        void addSafetyGroup(SafetyGroup grp)
        Adds this effector to the given safety group. This method may be called multiple times. This should establish a reference to that group, so that if this effector is found to be in an unsafe state, the groups it belongs to can be notified.
        Parameters:
        grp - The safety group that this effector is being added to.
